description:
When we encounter the Moon, we see a path that leads off into the distance. On either side of the path stand a wolf and a dog, representing our animalistic nature - one is civilized, and the other wild and feral. There is a crawfish that is crawling out of the pond from which the path stems from. In the distance, we can see two towers flanking the central path, once again alluding to the doubles visible in this card. Everything in this card seems to echo the other, as if to allude to two possibilities. When we walk down the path, we walk the fine line between conscious and unconscious, between the tamed side of civilization of the dog, and the forces of nature represented by the wolf.

The towers on the opposing ends represent the forces of good and evil, and their similarity in appearance can allude to the difficulties that we face in distinguishing between them.

upright.overview:
On one hand, the Moon card can symbolize your imagination is taking the best of you. In the dark of the night, you are taking a path that you are unsure of, for there could be danger lurking in its depths. You are the crawfish embarking on the path in the card. The moon's light can bring you clarity and understanding and you should allow your intuition to guide you through this darkness.

The moon's light can bring you clarity and understanding and you should allow your intuition to guide you through this darkness.

You need to be aware of the situations that are causing fear and anxiety in your mind, whether it is now or in the future. It alerts you not to allow inner disturbances and self-deception to take the best of you. These deep memories and fears must be let go, and the negative energies must be released and turned into something constructive.
Another reading of the Moon card is the existence of illusion. Some hidden truth must be discovered, for what you are seeing now may just be a trick of the light. You must search for the hidden forces that must be unraveled.
upright.love_meaning: With the Moon in a love tarot reading, it’s likely that emotions are complicated at this time. The environment can be one full of misunderstandings, and not everything is as it appears. You may need to do some work to get to the bottom of things; be sure to not only ensure the intentions of others, but also understand your own emotions, desires and motivations. There may be old attitudes, beliefs or ideas that are clouding your judgement. Many things can be hiding in your unconscious affecting your ability to accept love. Are past relationships haunting you? Have you lost faith in love? Do you believe you are unworthy of love? All of these can have profound affects on how we approach relationships. Now is the time to examine them and reveal them as they truly are.
upright.career_meaning: There may be some uncertainty when it comes to your career path right now. You may not have a clear understanding of what your goals are and which direction you should go towards. Alternatively, your workplace right now can be a tense atmosphere, one that comes from haziness and confusion about project goals, or what everyone should be doing. Misunderstandings can be rife right now, so make sure you express yourself clearly; it may be better to repeat yourself. By the same token, you may find that you don’t have all the information you need right now to make sound work decisions. Who can help shed some light on the facts?
upright.finances_meaning: Right now may not be the best time to make any big financial decisions, as the Moon signals that the information available to you right now isn’t complete. If you are in the process of taking financial action, don’t be afraid to dig deep and ask questions, so you can make the best decision possible. Confusion and uncertainty around finances may be a problem at the moment.
upright.as_feelings:
The Moon upright reveals a complex emotional landscape. This person feels confused and uncertain about their feelings for you. They’re drawn to you, yet fears and insecurities cloud their judgment. Their emotions fluctuate, leaving them unsure of how to express what they truly feel, creating an air of mystery around your connection.
The arrival of The Moon indicates that you're also navigating through a fog of emotions. You may feel intuitive but anxious, sensing deeper truths beneath the surface while wrestling with self-doubt or illusions. Trust your instincts and delve into these feelings; clarity will emerge from the shadows.
upright.as_actions: When you draw The Moon, you’re being asked to embrace uncertainty and trust your intuition. This card encourages you to explore the depths of your subconscious, allowing yourself to confront fears or illusions that may be holding you back. In practical terms, take time for self-reflection through journaling or meditation, which can help clarify your thoughts and feelings. Engage in creative activities like painting or writing to express what lies beneath the surface. Additionally, consider seeking guidance from a mentor or therapist who can provide insight into your emotional landscape. Embrace this journey as an opportunity for growth and transformation.
upright.love: complicated romance, uncertainty about love or relationship
upright.career: uncertainty around career path, confusion at job, lack of information
upright.finances: unclear around financial decisions, lacking financial knowledge

reversed.overview:
A Moon reversal in a reading can sometimes indicate that the darker and more negative aspects of the moon are present in your life. It could represent confusion and unhappiness - you want to make progress, but you are not sure what is the right thing to do. You must deal with your anxiety and fears by overcoming them, for they are like shadows in the dark. It is time to believe in yourself and move forward.
The moon reversal meaning indicates that you are in an intuitive period or you have recently battled confusion, anxiety, and self-deception. It could be that you are misinterpreting how you have been feeling however you are starting to improve on this.
Another reversed moon meaning is that the forces of the night that are bringing you confusion are starting to dissipate. You have started managing your fears and anxiety. Whatever negative energies you have been facing are slowly fading away. It presents a liberating experience as you discover the positive side of things.
reversed.love_meaning: The reversed Moon tarot love meaning can suggest that confusion and deception may be in the air. You may not have all the information you need at this moment, and you’ll have to rely on intuition in order to guide your way to the truth. Are you being honest with your partner? Are they being honest with you? Sometimes deception doesn’t necessarily have to have malicious motivations, but can even be done out of kindness or the desire to spare another person’s feelings. Hiding the truth however, is never a sustainable situation.
reversed.career_meaning: On one hand, the reversed Moon can signal the dissipation of the uncertainty and confusion that has characterized your job or workplace. Things may be more clear, and you may have a better understanding of which direction you should be working towards. Alternatively, the reversed Moon can also indicate a worsening of the situation, where misunderstandings and poor communication can even turn into deception, lying and sabotage. Your anxieties and fear about the workplace or your colleagues can make your worst fears come true, as everyone becomes more defensive, protective and paranoid.
reversed.finances_meaning: In the best cases, the reversed Moon can signal finding clarity about your financial situation and your financial goals. You are getting all the information you need to feel comfortable about a big decision or an investment in your future. At worst however, the reversed Moon can also suggest that there may be deception regarding your finances. Listen to your instincts; but try and separate your fears from intuition.
reversed.as_feelings:
The arrival of the reversed The Moon suggests a cloud of confusion and uncertainty surrounding how someone feels about you. They may be grappling with self-doubt or fear, leading them to question their feelings for you. This card suggests that they are struggling to see things clearly, possibly feeling overwhelmed by illusions or misinterpretations of your relationship.
In terms of your own feelings, the reversed The Moon indicates that you might be experiencing anxiety or insecurity regarding this connection. You could feel a lack of clarity about what you truly want or need from this person, prompting introspection and a desire to confront any fears holding you back from deeper emotional engagement. Embrace this opportunity for self-discovery as it can lead to greater understanding and resolution within yourself.
reversed.as_actions: The arrival of The Moon reversed suggests that now is the time to confront your fears and illusions. You may be feeling lost or uncertain, but this card urges you to seek clarity. Start by journaling your thoughts and feelings; writing can help illuminate what’s hidden in your subconscious. Engage in honest conversations with trusted friends or mentors who can provide perspective. Additionally, consider grounding practices like meditation or nature walks to reconnect with reality and dispel confusion. Embrace vulnerability by facing what scares you instead of avoiding it; this will lead to personal growth and a clearer path forward.
reversed.love: deception, fear and paranoia regarding love
reversed.career: clarity at work, sabotage, deception and trickery at workplace
reversed.finances: clarity about finances, deception regarding finances

abyss: Near the edges of two cliffs, two figures stand, wrapped in rays of luminescent moonlight. The male stands upon the right cliff, while his female counterpart stands upon the left cliff. They represent the primordial active and passive energies, spirit and matter, light and dark. There is only a small gap between them, making it easy for them to cross and unite. Yet, one false step could be their undoing. The Moon governs the tides. Its ever-changing phases exert a constantly shifting influence upon the waters of the Earth, as well as upon our emotional lives. Each one of us is connected to the Moon through occult energies that shift our emotional bodies. In contrast to the Sun, which shines constantly and reliably, completely illuminating the world—the Moon provides only intermittent and indirect light. The Moon provides general impressions but cannot be relied upon to reveal the whole truth. There is something mystical to its permanence, its stillness and silence. For this reason, it is important to proceed with caution. When the Moon card appears in your reading it signals a period of fluctuation and change. For most of us, the inability to clearly distinguish our surroundings instills a sense of fear and anxiety reminiscent of childhood fears of the dark. Moonlight dances lightly at nighttime, it hints but doesn't reveal all, and what we see by moonlight can turn out to be quite different in daylight. Therefore, it is not at all difficult to misperceive objects or intentions. Beware then of false impressions throughout this period, as it's quite easy to lose your step and be deceived. It's also wise not to make any major decisions or changes during this time.
